div.span: This Addendum shall form part of the Tenancy Contract No; _____________________ and must be read in conjunction with the Contract between the “Landlord” __________________________ (LL) “Tenant” ________________________________ (TT).
The “Premises” shall mean the property including gardens, common communal entrances facilities. “Fixtures, Furnishings and Fittings” shall mean all that is now in or on the Premises.
The TT and LL agree as follows:

tr.td:
1 Security Deposit
1.1 The Tenant has paid AED _______/-
(________________________) with 1 st year contract as a security Deposit. This will be refunded to the Tenant when vacating, subject to the Premises being left in a satisfactory condition as to when the apartment was handed over to the Tenant and Tenant and receipts of all paid bills being given to The Landlord.
1.2 If any damages are formed or necessary repair paint or cleaning works are required the LL reserves the right to deduct the cost of such expenses from TT’s security deposit subject to normal wear and tear.
2 Use of Premises
2.1 It is understood that the TT will use the Premises for residential purposes only and the TT shall not use the Premises to carry out any profession, trade or business whatsoever.
2.2 The TT is not allowed to assign, sublet or lease the property to any third party.
2.3 The TT shall not make any addition or alteration to the Premises without the written consent of the LL.
2.4 The erection of any board or notice visible from outside of the property advertising any profession, trade, business, goods or service is prohibited.
2.5 Rules of Association shall apply as set by the developer.
2.6 The TT shall not do or permit any act that may cause injury, damage, nuisance or annoyance to a neighbouring property or person and shall respect any community by laws.
2.7 The Premises shall not be used for any illegal or immoral purpose in contravention of any emirate regulation or by law.
2.8 The keeping of any pets on the Premises must be with prior consent of the LL. As per the community rules “pets are not allowed” and if any such violation is reported by the community management, the TT shall rectify this immediately.
2.9 It is understood that the municipality reserve the right to evict non-sharing families.
2.10 The TT shall not glue carpet or wooden grippers to the floor surfaces.
3 Terms of Payment
3.1 The Tenant shall pay the rent annually in advance in _ (_____) Cheques Instalments.
3.2 The TT understands that non-clearance of a cheque is unlawful, and they shall be charged AED 500 for each bounced cheque.
4 Interior Furnishing
4.1 The TT shall not remove at any time during or after the tenancy any item of fixtures, furnishings and fittings.
4.2 Insuring the contents of the property is the responsibility of the TT.
5 Reinstatement/ Reconstruction
5.1 By the end of this Tenancy Contract, the TT will be responsible for reinstatement or reconstruction of any areas/parts/furniture removed, damaged (other than normal wear tear), or change inside of the Premises to the Landlord’s Satisfaction.
5.2 Upon vacation of the Premises, the LL is not responsible for reimbursing any money spent by the TT on the upgrading of the Premises.
5.3 The TT agrees to make good, repair or cover replacement cost any item damaged by the TT, his family or guests.

6 Maintenance and Utilities
6.1 The TT will keep the interior of the Premises and fixtures and fittings (including paint and decorations and appliances) in good condition during the tenancy.
6.2 The TT undertakes to immediately notify the LL in the event of fire, flood or any other incident involving the Premises or upon the discovery of any damage or fault in the Premises requiring repair or attention.
6.3 The Tenant is responsible for all minor maintenance repairs upto AED 500 per Invoice or per visit of service provider to the premises including electrical, plumbing, air-conditioning servicing, gas, thermostat etc, any cost above AED 500 per Invoice or per visit of service provider will be the responsibility of LL (This does not include any upgradation to the unit or any consumables like lights , wooden flooring, wall paper, etc).
6.4 The TT shall be responsible for all utility consumption charges that are directly billed to the TT during the tenancy, including, DEWA, Cooling charges, Municipality Taxes, telephone, television and internet charges as well as any new government charges that may be levied.
6.5 Community Service charges are the responsibility of the LL.
6.6 The TT shall be responsible for the maintenance and associated charges for the lawns, shrubs and trees if present within the Premises.
6.7 Positive Properties has no responsibility towards any maintenance repairs and or management unless otherwise specified or employed to do so by either party.
6.8 At the time of vacating the Premises, the TT will pay up and produce the receipts for the final DEWA, AC and utility bills.
6.9 The TT shall permit the LL or his representative access to the Premises (upon reasonable notice) for the purpose of repairing snags or inspecting the Premises.
6.10 The TT responsibility to register the Ejari contract and cancel the Ejari contract at the end of the Tenancy and provide proof of cancellation.
7 End of Tenancy
7.1 This tenancy contract can be renewed after one year, subject to the TT giving the LL at least 90 days’ notice, in writing, prior to the expiry date and the LL accepting, in writing.
7.2 In the event that the LL wishes the TT to vacate the Premises for the purpose of moving in or selling the property, the LL should notify the TT, in writing, stamped by the courts and notary public/Fed EX’d twelve months prior to the expiry of the contract and in line with RERA guidelines.
7.3 IIn the event of the LL and TT extending the Tenancy for a further year a rent review shall take place according to the current RERA rental index calculator.
7.4 In the event of the TT and LL agreeing to renew the Tenancy Contract, Positive Properties will charge an administration fee of AED 500 + VAT to draw up a new Tenancy Contract payable by the TT.
7.5 If the TT does not wish to extend the tenancy, he agrees to give access in the last 30 days of the tenancy to show prospective new tenants, being given at least one day’s notice for viewings
7.6 The TT shall clean the Premises and return it as it was handed over to the TT at the time of occupying it.
7.7 The TT agrees to re-paint the apartment prior to vacating the Premises or pay the LL for the cost of such re-painting.
7.8 In the event that the TT wishes to vacate the Premises prior to the expiry of the contract, the TT shall give 2 months’ written notice and pay a penalty equivalent to Two month’s rent and the LL shall reimburse the balance of the rent and the security deposit.
